checks.name: Check-WindowsUpdate
checks.description: Checks if Windows Update is enabled and up to date. This should be enabled and up to date to ensure your system is patched against the latest vulnerabilities.

checks.name: Check-WindowsFirewall
checks.description: Checks if Windows Firewall is enabled. This should be enabled to prevent unauthorized traffic being sent to and from to your system over the network.

checks.name: Check-WindowsDefender
checks.description: Checks if Windows Defender is enabled. This should be enabled to prevent unauthorized software and malicious programs being installed/ran on your system.

checks.name: Check-GuestAccount
checks.description: Checks if the Guest Account is disabled. This is a security best practice to prevent an attacker from having a default account to access your system with.

checks.name: Check-ProcessRunningAsAdmin
checks.description: Checks if any processes are running as administrator that shouldn't be

checks.name: Check-SoftwareUpdate
checks.description: Checks if software is up to date

checks.name: Check-OpenPorts
checks.description: Checks if any ports are open that could be exploited - this check may take some time to run

checks.name: Check-AppLockerPolicy
checks.description: Checks if AppLocker is enabled and configured correctly - AppLocker can be used to restrict applications from untrusted developers from running on your system

checks.name: Check-WebFiltering
checks.description: Checks if web filtering is enabled and configured correctly - web filtering can be used to block access to malicious websites and prevent malware infections

checks.name: Check-PasswordPolicy
checks.description: Checks if the password policy is configured correctly - a strong password policy is a crucial part of ensuring the security of your system

checks.name: Check-RemoteDesktop
checks.description: Checks if Remote Desktop is enabled - RDP could provide an attacker access your system remotely
